meanings.definition: A person who betrays a friend, country, or principle.
meanings.sent1: The traitor revealed secrets to the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The country was shocked by the actions of the traitor.
meanings.sent3: The traitor thought they could get away with their deceitful actions.
meanings.sent4: His betrayal marked him as a traitor in the eyes of his former allies.
meanings.sent5: The traitor's actions will forever stain their reputation.

meanings.sent1: She chose to traitor her best friend by spreading rumors.
meanings.sent2: It is never right to traitor those who trust you.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally traitored his own team by giving away their strategy.
meanings.sent4: The company felt betrayed when the employee decided to traitor them for a competitor.
meanings.sent5: Betraying your values will always lead you to traitor others.
